item.title: Type-level Collatz Sequence
item.description: Implementing the famous Collatz conjecture entirely within TypeScript’s type system, demonstrating type-level arithmetic and recursive computation. The sequence follows $n \rightarrow n/2$ if even, $n \rightarrow 3n+1$ if odd, conjecturing all positive integers reach 1. Using template literal types and conditional type recursion, we can compute Collatz<27> yielding the 111-step sequence purely at compile time - pushing TypeScript’s type system to perform actual mathematical computation.
